entry.title: Gist test
entry.content:
Last night, Jekyll’s Gist tag didn’t work during preview.

This morning, I tried using git bisect to figure out the cause of this problem. It turns out that it isn’t a problem of Octopress’ Gist tag. It’s actually a problem of my code highlighter and gist cache.
entry.summary: Last night, Jekyll’s Gist tag didn’t work during preview.

entry.title: C Stdlib Location Failure
entry.content:
I expect that the following command return the absolute path of stdio.h.

user@OWNER-PC:~$ locate stdio.h
locate: can not stat () `/var/lib/mlocate/mlocate.db': No such file or directory

A database update worked, though it took several minutes.

user@OWNER-PC:~$ sudo updatedb
[sudo] password for user:

^Z
[1]+  Stopped                 sudo updatedb
user@OWNER-PC:~$ fg
sudo updatedb
user@OWNER-PC:~$ locate stdio.h
/mnt/c/Perl/lib/CORE/nostdio.h
/mnt/c/RubyDevKit/lib/perl5/5.8/msys/CORE/nostdio.h
/mnt/c/RubyDevKit/mingw/include/c++/4.7.2/tr1/stdio.h
/mnt/c/RubyDevKit/mingw/lib/gcc/x86_64-w64-mingw32/4.7.2/include/ssp/stdio.h
/mnt/c/RubyDevKit/mingw/x86_64-w64-mingw32/include/stdio.h
/usr/include/stdio.h
/usr/include/c++/4.8/tr1/stdio.h
/usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu/bits/stdio.h
/usr/lib/perl/5.18.2/CORE/nostdio.h
entry.summary: I expect that the following command return the absolute path of stdio.h.

entry.title: Keep Blogging
entry.content:
External-url: http://stormzhang.com/android/2016/03/04/why-i-keep-writing-blog/

This article explains why I keep posting something that interest few netizens.

entry.title: Catalan Number With GNU MP Library

link.title: Catalan Number With GNU MP Library

entry.content:
I have written some programs in C so that Catalan numbers and binomial coefficients can be calculated.

The program catalan.c does not work after $N = 17$ since too much memory is consumed. This has inspired me to write catalan-mul.c.

I have chosen C due to its speed.
entry.summary: I have written some programs in C so that Catalan numbers and binomial coefficients can be calculated.
